decks.notes: The deck focuses on using artifacts, specifically blue ones, to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It leverages cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Pithing Needle and Shadowspear provide additional utility. The main win condition is to get ahead in tempo and keep the pressure on the opponent, utilizing artifacts to continuously apply pressure and control the game.

The deck primarily focuses on combining powerful spells and creatures to win the game in a single turn. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal, Cabal Ritual, and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana quickly, alongside creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to dump the entire library into the graveyard, the player aims to win with cards like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and ensure a successful execution.

This deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to win the game. The key strategy involves using various cards to effectively set up a winning scenario, such as Thassa's Oracle and Lotus Petal. The deck also includes cards like Personal Tutor and Thoughtseize to help search for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to efficiently and quickly assemble the combo pieces to secure a victory. The deck also includes a mix of control and disruption cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to maintain board presence and protect the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Atraxa, and Archon of Cruelty, then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play. Cards like Collective Brutality, Unmask, and Thoughtseize help disrupt the opponent's game plan while Cabal Therapy allows for targeted removal. Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal provide fast mana acceleration to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful reanimated creatures before they have a chance to respond effectively.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's plans while applying pressure with efficient threats. It uses cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt opponent's strategy, along with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game quickly. The deck also includes cards like Force of Will for protection and Wasteland for land disruption. The goal is to control the game tempo by making key plays and maintaining card advantage, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes cards to help find the necessary pieces, protect the combo with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze, and generate mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual. The goal is to carefully plan out the order of cards to stack the deck with Doomsday, followed by Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck is built around efficient and powerful card selection and manipulation to set up the game-winning combo.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently dump your entire deck into your graveyard, using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer. By doing this, you can set up your win condition by either milling over Thassa's Oracle and winning the game on the spot, or by bringing back a large number of creatures with Dread Return and Bridge from Below. The deck also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's strategy. It focuses on explosive plays and a fast win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck aims to use these combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats early in the game, supported by counter magic like Force of Will to protect its game plan. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection and manipulation, the deck aims to set up its combo pieces and execute its win condition as quickly as possible.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. By utilizing lands like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb for fast mana, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Glaring Fleshraker. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Wastescape Battlemage are included to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The key strategy is to quickly establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use artifacts, specifically Urza's Saga and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, to quickly generate mana and put pressure on your opponent with aggressive creatures like Patchwork Automaton and Pinnacle Emissary. The deck also includes disruption through cards like Force of Will and Pithing Needle to control the game and protect your key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to establish a fast board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. It also aims to maintain tempo with cards like Boomerang Basics and Wasteland while generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Murktide Regent serves as a powerful win condition that can quickly close out the game. Overall, the deck combines aggressive gameplay with disruption and card advantage to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the tempo of the game by utilizing a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Snuff Out. The deck also aims to apply pressure on the opponent with creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and applying pressure through efficient creatures, the deck seeks to outpace the opponent and secure a win through a combination of control and aggression.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells. By deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Barrowgoyf early in the game, along with disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Daze, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and control the pace of the game. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps dig for key cards, while cards like Brazen Borrower provide additional versatility. Overall, this deck aims to maintain tempo and put the opponent on the back foot throughout the match.

The main concept of this Death & Taxes aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Sink into Stupor, Force of Will, and Wasteland while applying pressure with creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Aang, Swift Savior. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Karakas and Swords to Plowshares, while also generating value through cards like Starfield Shepherd and Guide of Souls. The deck also has a subtheme of enchantments with cards like Meticulous Archive and Witch Enchanter, providing additional utility and synergy with the rest of the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and disrupting the opponent's mana base through cards like Trinisphere, Magus of the Moon, and Wasteland. By using fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal, the deck can quickly get ahead and put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Chancellor of the Annex and Simian Spirit Guide. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Caves of Chaos Adventurer to provide card advantage and additional threats. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, disruptive creatures and spells to secure a quick victory.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Show and Tell with Omniscience to cheat out Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, bypassing traditional mana costs. The deck includes plenty of card draw, counter spells, and search effects to find pieces of the combo efficiently. It also includes additional win conditions and protection with City of Traitors, Karakas, and Boseiju, Who Endures. The deck focuses on quickly ramping into its combo pieces and disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats.
